Being You @ IBM

Data without context is just a set of disconnected facts, meaningless points. To be useful, data needs to be converted into actionable knowledge. It needs to be intertwined into a bigger picture, associated with a hypothesis that needs to be solved. To do this we need an investigative sense, analytical experience and, above all, a curious mind.

CloudWalk wants to change how money is defined and used, and for that we need people that can navigate through uncharted waters of chaotic data. People that want to fight against this isomorphic world are all immersed into searching for new meanings, new possibilities.

The AI team is responsible for research and development of new models and methods for usage in all areas of the company, like Risk, Marketing and others. We are looking for someone to analyze and transform data from different origins; to generate reports, create tools and propose insights. Someone that will act as a bridge between the company Data Scientists and the business area.

What will you do?

Create and maintain data visualization and dashboards tools
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data from different sources
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Suggest and engage in team collaborations for novel projects


Must haves:

Knowledge of programming languages, especially Python and SQL
Solid Data Visualization skills to create charts and dashboards
Strong analytical skills, ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Communication skills. You should be able to communicate effectively with multiple teams. Ability to communicate and debate in English. Portuguese is not required


Nice to have:

Experience or interest in Machine Learning
Experience with the financial or payments industry
Web Scraping skills
Ability to work with dirty data
Knowledge of BI tools such as Metabase or Tableau
Experience with Cloud platforms like GCP


Benefits:

Health insurance for you + 1 family member
Life insurance
Meal allowance
Internet/ electricity allowance
30 days of paid vacation
Full home office
ZenKlub Partnership for wellness
Learning and Development resources
Extended maternity and paternity leaves

Alpargata‚Äôs data team works with a wide variety of technologies and methods to solve our challenges. We have a data chapter and our data scientists are distributed on tribes and squads. We are happy when we achieve simple solutions that aggregate value to the business! We believe that data science is the science of making data-driven decisions and we work side to side with our business partners. In this sense, we understand as our mission: ‚Äúto build data products for supporting business decisions‚Äù. We try to see beyond standards to develop solutions pragmatically and efficiently. An agile mindset, product management best practices and collaboration are in the kernel of our way of working.Some examples of what we do as a data & analytics team: we execute experimentation A/B testing, we build creative data explorations and data mining efforts to generate insights; we create predictive models trained with sklearn/keras/tensorflow/pytorch based on databricks platform; we create data pipelines to feed our data lake with AWS S3/Glue and deliver transformed data to a snowflake DW; In addition, we use tableau for delivering impactful data visualizations.The Data Analyst (analytics & data science) will develop data products from end to end, create and discuss architectural design of solutions and experiments with experienced data scientists. These data products will include data pipelines, ML/statistical models, experiments A/B tests, EDAs/data explorations and data visualizations aiming to generate value to the business in the context of one squad.Responsabilidades e atribui√ß√µesDevelop machine learning and statistical models;Deploy models to production by building APIs or via ETL pipelines;Use statistics, data mining and visualization techniques to model problems, find opportunities, discover solutions, and deliver actionable business insights;Create data pipelines to feed the data lake/DW and production models;Deliver simple and effective solutions;Use creative and innovative ways of solving problems and delivering solutions;Develop data products covering business understanding, data understanding, data preparation, model creation, validation and deploy;Create impactful presentations, translate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences;Guide less experienced colleagues on delivering models and data pipelines;Periodically present the results of her work to more experienced data scientists.Requisitos e qualifica√ß√µesBachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, etc.);Familiarity with agile methodologies;Facility on business understanding and data preparation;Experience on creating data pipelines;Experience with Machine Learning, Data Mining and Statistical Data Analysis techniques;Good foundation on design and analysis of experiments;Excellent storytelling and collaboration skills;Experience in SQL, Python, ETL/ELT, statistics/machine learning methods and data visualization tools;Knowledge on AWS Glue, S3, redshift, snowflake, databricks, dbt and PySpark is an advantage;High learning ability;Experience in the academic and research field is an advantage;Fluent in Portuguese and English is an advantage.Informa√ß√µes adicionais Independence to practice your abilities in a dynamic workspace; Flexible hours; Day Off ‚Äì Birthday; Talks and Courses ministered by our specialists; English Classes (In Company).

Description

_ Our business

Through technology (mobile, AI, automation, IOT), we have created a next-generation logistics network and we are, in an unprecedented way, positioning ourselves to unleash the growth of a new trade in Brazil with a fast, cost-effective and reliable logistics solution.

By the end of 2021, we want to be present in all Brazilian cities and reach the milestone of 5 million deliveries per day by 2025.

With SoftBank, Microsoft, GGV Capital and others, the new investment round has brought Loggi‚Äôs valuation up to US$1 billion hitting the unicorn mark!

‚ÄúOur mission is to deliver everything to everyone everywhere as quickly as possible. We want to connect Brazil and value, for example, Amazonian handicrafts, enabling artisans to sell without intermediaries to consumers in any region.‚Äù (Fabien Mendez, CEO - Chief Executive Officer)

_ Our Engineering team

Loggi‚Äôs engineering team is focused on solving highly complex problems, mixing up very experienced professionals and early career employees, in a fortified environment by learning, sharing of experiences and respect. Together, we will build the logistics network of the country, developing unique algorithms, systems and processes.

Our leaders have already left their mark in the national and worldwide tech scenario, working in companies like Google and UOL. They are engaged in finding how to develop a group of more than a thousand programmers to explore the knowledge borders and connect the country.

We Believe And Invest In Everyone's Potential

"Over the next 5 years we want to train Brazil‚Äôs future CTOs! Here, we have a structured development program." (Davi Reis, CTO - Chief Technology Officer)

Requirements

_ Responsibilities

You will architect and develop scalable solutions through data, being part of multidisciplinare squads seeking an amazing and efficient experience for the users! We will count on you to structure relevant data pipelines that support decision making and to make sure that the teams have access to high quality data information.

Loggi‚Äôs data team works with a wide variety of technologies and techniques to solve our challenges. We try to see beyond the buzzwords to develop solutions in a pragmatic and efficient way.

To spark your curiosity, we work with predictive models trained with sklearn and keras/tensorflow; algorithms of optimization based on or-tools, Systems in Azure and AWS, with and without kubernetes. In addition we also use Looker and ELK for dashboards and analysis.

Above everything, we expect desire and the ability to acquire knowledge and learn fast.

_ Requirements

3+ years of relevant work experience in Data Analytics;
Experience with design and analysis of experiments;
Strong analytical and storytelling skills;
Collaborative profile, to work with other data analysts, engineers, product managers, and designers;
Familiarity with agile trends;
Experience in the academic field is a plus;
Experience working with software development (with Python)
Experience working with sensitive data would be a plus
Interest in learning about data integrations
Interest in building a new data infra-structure for people analytics

Benefits

Health plan with national coverage (without discounts!)

Dental plan (also without discounts!)

Flexible hours with the possibility of working at home according to function and demand

Discounts of up to 75% in gyms all over Brazil

Fresh fruit every day at the office

We Support You With

Above average remuneration of the best technology companies in Brazil, with annual reviews

Eligibility for Stock Options

Meal voucher and transportation voucher with symbolic discount of R$ 1

Possibility of payroll loan after 3 months of company

We Develop You With

US$ 3,300 for technical development per year

Immersion week in all areas of the company, our famous Xboarding

Frequent knowledge exchanges with internal and external professionals

Individual development plan updated every six months

Feedback culture and opportunity to work according to the squad concept

Working with big names in the history of technology in Brazil

Possibility to develop new algorithms with the challenge of creating the new generation of logistics

We Help Parents With

Health and dental plan for children at no extra cost

6-month maternity leave and 20-day paternity leave

Daycare allowance of R$ 457 per child up to 5 years of age

Some Of Our Offices Also Have

Massage, manicure, pedicure at reduced costs

Pet day

Game rooms with video games, pool and others

Locker room and spaces to store your bike or scooter safely

Marketplace selling quick meals, drinks and snacks

_ Our culture

Inclusive, determined and visionary: that's who we are and how we work here.

We are already more than 1000 Loggers. We are hi-tech, little conservative and we are always up to date! Above all, we hope that everyone is eager to learn and acquire new knowledge quickly.

We look for an increasingly inspiring and welcoming work environment, and we very much hope that you will help us to maintain our culture even at an accelerated pace of growth.

We are very happy to be recognized among the best startups to work according to LinkedIn and Glassdoor, among the 10 most innovative startups by Forbes Brasil and also to be certified by Great Place to Work.

Being part of Loggi must mean that you can be who you are - or want to be. We look for a more accessible country. Thus, we can say that respecting the needs of different people is our reason for existing. This is history, it is culture, it is respect.

Important: All Loggi jobs are also open to people with disabilities (PwD).

This job description is written in English because we already have a technology office in Europe, and as we are hiring professionals from all over the world, you can have interactions with professionals who do not speak Portuguese.

Essa descri√ß√£o de vaga est√° escrita em Ingl√™s porque n√≥s j√° temos um escrit√≥rio de tecnologia na Europa e, como estamos contratando profissionais de todo o mundo, voc√™ pode ter intera√ß√µes com profissionais que n√£o falam Portugu√™s.

Let's go together?
Industry: Servi√ßos e consultoria de TI, Publica√ß√£o na Internet e Servi√ßos de recursos humanos

About The Team

The Finance Business Analysis team handles huge amounts of financial data. The team's activities range from processing data, reconciling numbers and automating tasks to building insightful dashboards and reports.

We appreciate having people with different backgrounds, as our activities require a good mix of tech, business and communication skills. We are always learning something new to keep up with and support Shopee's growth.

Come make history with us if you seek to work in a dynamic environment and are interested in combining your data and finance skills!

Job Description

Understand current Finance data processes to suggest applicable accuracy and time saving best practices.
Implement ETL routines and improvements using, SQL, Python, VBScript and Power Query.
Play as a key contact point between Finance Business Analysis team and various other Finance teams, such Reconciliation, Treasury, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable and Accounting.
Provide essential communication, documentation, QA testing and system support for daily operations and projects.
Troubleshoot system-related issues.
Manage across multiple user groups‚Äô needs, concerns and issues regarding changes, enhancements, fixes.
Prioritize project timelines based on the financial impacts while maintaining high levels of data accuracy.


Requirements

Degree holder preferably in a technical field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, etc; or Degree holder in a business related field as long as there is a strong interest in data analysis;
Excellent knowledge with Python, SQL and Office package;
Basic knowledge in Finance;
Strong logical and analytical thinking skills;
Good communications skills in English;

Description:
Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.

There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us.

Firstly, we‚Äôve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you‚Äôre welcome at BT, we really mean it.

Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. Smart working means having the flexibility to choose, as a team, how and where you work depending on your team‚Äôs deliverables and needs; when you are at your shared core location to connect with others and when not. It may not be for every role, and, as part of the recruitment process, you‚Äôll have the chance to discuss smart working and how it might work for the job you are applying for.

About This Role

What is BT connecting for good? - YouTube

Group Business Services (GBS) is part of BT Group that delivers diverse range of business services across the whole of BT. Our vision is to create an organisation that is fully aligned and integrated with the customer facing units.

With a 10,000 people strong workforce, we help drive business growth, enhance profitability, optimise the cost base and provide competitive differentiation. We continue to serve BT‚Äôs customers ‚Äì both external and internal - as efficiently and effectively as possible. Our customers are at the heart of everything we do.

Group Business Assurance (GBA) operates as a 2nd Line of defence, assuring the end to end (E2E) accuracy of supplier and customer charging whilst giving insight and consultancy to the business on improvements and optimisation opportunities

Supports the input into and execution of the GBA strategy for the ongoing assurance of products and contracts within their CFU.

You'll Have The Following Responsibilities

Accountable for business engagement across a wide range of operational CFU stakeholders.
Has detailed understanding of one or more key Lead 2 Cash / product / contract areas and uses business assurance knowledge to carry out/support 2nd line control coverage assessments, product end-to-end assessments and risk and control reviews.
Uses understanding of the audit of processes and systems along with commercial insight to define and recommend new or amend appropriate coverage and controls, and ensure they are executed
Carries out root cause analysis and root cause management at CFU level (working with Control Operations and Recovery).
May be required to support Specialists in management of third party suppliers and interaction with auditors and regulatory authorities.

You'll Have The Following Skills & Experience

Proven experience in the role of Data Analyst
Experience with developing and implementing databases, data collection/extraction programs for primary and secondary data sources
Excellent Excell skills
Language ‚Äì Portuguese and English at Fluent level

Desirable

Knowledge/ experience of GBA strategic tools e.g. Margin Tool, OBI & RAVN
Continuous Improvement / Lean knowledge & experience

Benefits

COVID-19 Notice: We‚Äôve changed our recruitment process so that we can continue to offer exciting opportunities in the Americas. We‚Äôve moved to ‚Äòvirtual hiring‚Äô until further notice - which includes video interviews and virtual onboarding, to make sure that we maintain candidate and employee safety.

What are the perks to work at BT?

BT offers a superior global culture that fosters health and wellness for their employees. BT has kept employees informed with the latest updates during this unprecedented time and provided excellent benefit offerings to support employees and their families.

IF ON ANNUAL BT BONUS:

This opportunity is eligible for an annual bonus, a competitive base salary, comprehensive benefits and a generous vacation package.

About BT

BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.

We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.

So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT

How To Apply

It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

Description:
You will be part of an innovative fast-growing Ag-Fintech company, whose mission is to revolutionize agricultural finance through data science and machine learning. You will be part of a dynamic and experienced team, contributing to analyze big data from our various databases and data sources to identify correlations that are valuable to the business.

Your responsibilities will mainly include, but will not be limited to, the following:

Work output of the models and analyze to understand where the greatest opportunities for improvement in modeling are.
Build indicators to infer the quality of data, modeling, and processes.
Create SQL queries that support the delivery of ad-hoc analytics.Capture and prioritize data visualization requirements with stakeholders and connect these data views with existing data pipelines.
Create and deliver effective data visualizations to support business decision making.
Recommend different ways and tools to constantly improve data visualization and insight representations.
Identify patterns and trends in data sets.
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques.
Develop tests to validate general cases and edge cases.
Develop and implement data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases
Define new data collection and analysis processes.
Work alongside the data science team to turn unique insights into actionable experiences through visualizations and automation.
Work alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs.


Requirements

2+ years of experience in data analysis, data treatment and data bases.
2+ years of experience in Python and SQL.
2+ years of experience in credit risk analysis: estimation, validation and stress-testing of risk parameters (PD, LGD, and CCF/EAD)
Understand the data integration tech stack used by data analysts and engineers.
Exceptional analytical, quantitative, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Ability to design KPI and metrics.
Professional experience working with a remote team and agile methodology.
Enthusiastic, flexible team player who loves to dive in and ‚Äúfigure it out.‚Äù


Preferred qualifications:

Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Superset and others.
Experience with AWS or another cloud system.
Advanced use of Microsoft Excel.
Experience with git.


Attendance Requirements:

Traive is currently a hybrid workplace in terms of office attendance, namely all employees are required to attend the office a minimum number of days, while they may work the rest outside the office. The attendance policy may change from time to time depending on the safety requirements and precautions due to the pandemic, or other considerations.

Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Job type: Permanent

Location: Sao Paulo

Reporting Relationship: Regional Head of Data Science

Argus is a fast-growing global B2B price reporting, consulting and conferences business providing essential information on commodity markets. As a business, we continue to grow and evolve, adding new markets, new services, new delivery options and improved analytical tools and data is a key part of our organisation.

Job Purpose

Due to the continued growth of both the business and its range of data products, we are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our Global Data Team in Sao Paulo. You will work closely with internal clients of the Data team to develop and support the applications and processes which underpin Argus‚Äô data-driven products.

Over time, you will gain exposure to R and other technologies that support data engineering for machine learning, artificial intelligence and analytics, through on-the-job and formal training programs.

Key Responsibilities

Develop, support and maintain systems for data processing and report-building
Provide client support with queries relating to
integration of Argus data and metadata into client systems
data validation
provision of data
Support wider initiatives and product development by the Data & Data Science function
Data and systems support to Argus‚Äô staff


Required Skills And Experience

Excellent spoken and written English
Experience of developing tools using VBA in MS Excel
Knowledge and experience of SQL
Ability to work both as part of a team and autonomously
Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Desired Skills And Experience

Experience with R
BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, Engineering or related field
Experience in visualisation techniques


Personal Attributes

Excellent attention to detail
Ability to interact with non-technical people in plain language
Innovative thinker with good problem-solving abilities
Numerically proficient
Self-motivated with ability to work independently, prioritising tasks to meet deadlines


About Argus Media

Argus is a leading energy and commodity price reporting agency providing data, news and insight as well as conference and consulting services. Companies in more than 140 countries around the world use Argus prices to index physical trade and as benchmarks in financial derivative markets as well as for analysis and planning purposes.

Half of Argus' 900 employees are commodity journalists who specialise in reporting news and price information relating to physical energy and related commodity markets. They operate according to a rigorous Editorial Code of Conduct and a Compliance and Ethics Policy that align with best journalistic practice, including the avoidance of conflicts of interest.

Argus was founded in 1970 and is a privately held UK-registered company. It is owned by staff shareholders and global growth equity firm General Atlantic and Hg Capital.

Benefits

Our rapidly growing, award winning business offers a dynamic environment for talented, entrepreneurial professionals to achieve results and grow their careers. Argus recognises and rewards successful performance and as an Investor in People, we promote professional development and retain a high-performing team committed to building our success.

Competitive salary
Group medical and dental plans
Company life insurance plan
Private pension scheme
Extensive internal and external training


Apply

If this aligns with your next career move, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Apply via our website www.argusmedia.com/en/careers/open-positions

Job Title: Analista de Sistemas Pleno (Banco de Dados) - Remoto
Description:
At UL, we know why we come to work.

Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

What You‚Äôll Learn & Achieve

Sustainability Implementation Consultant - Remote

The Sustainability Implementation Consultant will work with our range of award winning UL360 Sustainability Software solutions on customer software implementations, consultancy, training and may deliver related advisory services.

Consultancy and Configuration

Serve as a subject matter expert of product implementation in one or more areas of the product offerings
Assess client's needs and requirements and advise client on best practice or common approach
Identify solution options based on client requirements and author specification documentation
Configure the system as per specification or requirements using the system user interface
Verify (QA) that configuration / implementation is in accordance with the agreed specification
Provide system implementation documentation for handover to our Support teams
Liaison with Product Management for advanced configuration and development of the system
Work with technical teams to resolve system and configuration issues.
Lead customer meetings and calls as and when required in support of larger implementation project, ensuring a professional image at all times
Provide assistance and advice to existing clients including e.g. report generation at critical times of the year
Advise and assist the client in maintaining and enhancing their implemented solution
Serve as configuration workstream lead on complex implementation projects
Provide support, guidance and coaching to more junior team members on projects helping educate them on system functionality

Training

Provide training to clients on implemented functionality
Draft training documentation both generically for the system and for client-specific purposes.

What Makes You a Great Fit

Required skills, knowledge and characteristics

Background in IT. University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
Background or proven keen interest in Sustainability (management & reporting, e.g. GHG, SASB, GRI, CDP) and / or Supply Chain
Effective communicator with good interpersonal skills
Previous 2+ years experience in a customer facing role with a private sector company
High level of numeracy
Strong working knowledge of Excel
Detail oriented
Familiarity with web based applications and software implementation/configuration
Fluent English is essential and additional languages desirable
Ability to learn new software applications rapidly
Knowledge of relational databases or technical expertise is desirable (e.g. SQL, XML)

For more information about the UL360 SaaS software, go to https//www.ul.com/resources/apps/360-sustainability

What You‚Äôll Experience Working At UL

Mission For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn‚Äôt new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 127 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.
People Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you‚Äôll almost always hear, ‚Äúthe people.‚Äù Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We‚Äôre able to deliver the best because we employ the best.
Interesting work Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers‚Äô create. We‚Äôre inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.
Grow & achieve We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles.

Learn More

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst - AI Data Acquisition
Description:
You will be part of an innovative fast-growing Ag-Fintech company, whose mission is to revolutionize agricultural finance through data science and machine learning. You will be part of a dynamic and experienced team, contributing to identifying the best data sources to compose the main inputs of the models.

Your responsibilities will mainly include, but will not be limited to, the following:

Point of contact with the main government agencies to ensure the data is up to date and entering our system in a fluid way.
Participate in negotiations with our partners and seek synergies with other companies.
Manage contracts with data sources and ensure optimal use of the information we have.
Build indicators to infer data quality and process efficiency.
Keep the data pipeline fueled with the best source of information.
Identify regional data providers.
Lead business negotiations on data acquisition.
Manage supplier and service contracts.
Lead business partnerships involving data.
Identify synergies in the market for the optimized use of data and information.


Requirements

Good negotiation skills.
Excellent communication.
Management of activities, deadlines and tasks.
Teamwork experience.
Good English level.
Ability to work in remote teams.
Experience in handling CSV, Excel files.
Advanced use of Microsoft Excel.
Enthusiastic, flexible team player who loves to dive in and ‚Äúfigure it out.‚Äù


Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of the Agronomic market in Brazil.
Knowledge of the financial basics.
Familiarity or experience with data management.


Attendance Requirements:

Traive is currently a hybrid workplace in terms of office attendance, namely all employees are required to attend the office a minimum number of days, while they may work the rest outside the office. The attendance policy may change from time to time depending on the safety requirements and precautions due to the pandemic, or other considerations.

Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

What You‚Äôll Learn & Achieve

Sustainability Implementation Consultant - Remote

The Sustainability Implementation Consultant will work with our range of award winning UL360 Sustainability Software solutions on customer software implementations, consultancy, training and may deliver related advisory services.

Consultancy and Configuration

Serve as a subject matter expert of product implementation in one or more areas of the product offerings
Assess client's needs and requirements and advise client on best practice or common approach
Identify solution options based on client requirements and author specification documentation
Configure the system as per specification or requirements using the system user interface
Verify (QA) that configuration / implementation is in accordance with the agreed specification
Provide system implementation documentation for handover to our Support teams
Liaison with Product Management for advanced configuration and development of the system
Work with technical teams to resolve system and configuration issues.
Lead customer meetings and calls as and when required in support of larger implementation project, ensuring a professional image at all times
Provide assistance and advice to existing clients including e.g. report generation at critical times of the year
Advise and assist the client in maintaining and enhancing their implemented solution
Serve as configuration workstream lead on complex implementation projects
Provide support, guidance and coaching to more junior team members on projects helping educate them on system functionality

Training

Provide training to clients on implemented functionality
Draft training documentation both generically for the system and for client-specific purposes.

What Makes You a Great Fit

Required skills, knowledge and characteristics

Background in IT. University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
Background or proven keen interest in Sustainability (management & reporting, e.g. GHG, SASB, GRI, CDP) and / or Supply Chain
Effective communicator with good interpersonal skills
Previous 2+ years experience in a customer facing role with a private sector company
High level of numeracy
Strong working knowledge of Excel
Detail oriented
Familiarity with web based applications and software implementation/configuration
Fluent English is essential and additional languages desirable
Ability to learn new software applications rapidly
Knowledge of relational databases or technical expertise is desirable (e.g. SQL, XML)

For more information about the UL360 SaaS software, go to https//www.ul.com/resources/apps/360-sustainability

What You‚Äôll Experience Working At UL

Mission For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn‚Äôt new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 127 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.
People Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you‚Äôll almost always hear, ‚Äúthe people.‚Äù Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We‚Äôre able to deliver the best because we employ the best.
Interesting work Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers‚Äô create. We‚Äôre inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.
Grow & achieve We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles.

Learn More

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

About the role

We're looking for a passionate Growth Analytics Analyst who excels in critical thinking and planning knowledge. In this role, you will be working closely with growth teams globally to develop driver and passenger growth acquisition on Brazil. If you are a go-better with a start-up spirit looking to create value you would be great with this team!




In this role, you'll be...

Use internal data to build insights, develop a strategy, outline tests, and scale successful results for acquisition.
Then apply those learnings and do it all again. Manage large cross-functional projects: Work across paid performance, referral, and planning to implement, projects that deepen DiDi¬¥s understanding of our driver and passenger.
Balance attention to detail with swift execution: We need to do things quickly, and we need to do them well.
You will help build a hard-working, challenging but fun workplace.
Part of the team that will be in charge of evolve growth with analysis.
Be responsible for structure our acquisition strategy based on quantitative and qualitative assumptions.




We're eager to be in touch because you...

Have majored in Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or other analytically-focused academy.
All backgrounds are welcome if you see yourself suitable in a highly analytic environment background. (We have preference for people who are excited by challenges where there is constant change and when things can be created from scratch.
Highly data driven. (focused in growth & user acquisition strategies).
Previous professional experience in analytical, modeling, operational, and/or growth roles preferred.
Excellent communication skills in English and Portuguese.
Experience with data-based decision-making, exercising good judgment in ambiguous circumstances.
SQL, Python/R advanced.

Description:
LexisNexis Risk Solutions provides a full portfolio of Professional Services to expertly guide any business, of any size, through the design, implementation and ongoing optimization of best in class fraud, identity and authentication solutions.




Helping customers get the most out of their technology investment, the Engagement and Analytics team provides a range of services, from strategy optimization and consulting, to onsite support and Quarterly Business Reviews.




The Fraud Data Analyst works as part of a customer engagement team to support large banking, financial, and insurance customers in their deployment of fraud and identity solutions. This is primarily a consultant role with a technical and analytics bent.




Responsibilities




Review suspicious activity and complex fraud cases to identify new risks and issues
Analyze data in order to build and adjust rules that identify fraud, reduce friction, and regulate customer workflows in real-time
Deliver persuasive analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences ‚Äì sometimes in-person at the customer site
Advise clients on best practices for their technical implementation and analysis of ThreatMetrix DDP and other LexisNexis Risk Solutions
Maintain on-going relationships with each client‚Äôs fraud managers, risk analysts, application developers, project managers as well as internally with other ThreatMetrix LNRS teams




Basic Qualifications




Native or fluent in Portuguese, Spanish and English
Ability to travel up to 10%
Quantitative or technical degree
2+ years of experience managing large customer-facing solutions
2+ years of experience in financial services, banks, or insurance organizations
2+ years of experience delivering analytics using tools such as Python (pandas, sklearn, matplotlib) or R
Demonstrated competence using SQL and Excel for reports
Willingness to conduct root-cause analysis of client‚Äôs issues and learn new products
Motivated to help customers succeed and deliver value through proof-of-concept analysis




Desired Experience




Experience investigating financial crimes and fraud -- account takeover, card not present, money laundering, social engineering etc.
Knowledge or research involving cybersecurity - browser-fingerprinting, public key infrastructure, computer networking, device authentication etc.
Experience in statistical/scorecard modeling or graph analysis to deliver insights ‚Äì especially as it pertains to credit risk or fraud detection




About LexisNexis Risk Solutions

LexisNexis Risk Solutions harnesses the power of data and advanced analytics to provide insights that help businesses and governmental entities reduce risk and improve decisions to benefit people around the globe. We provide data and technology solutions for a wide range of industries including insurance, financial services, healthcare and government. We have offices throughout the world and are part of RELX Group (LSE: REL/NYSE: RELX), a global provider of information and analytics for professional and business customers across industries. RELX is a FTSE 100 company and is based in London. For more information, please visit www.risk.lexisnexis.com, and www.relx.com

Description:
At UL, we know why we come to work.

Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

What You‚Äôll Learn & Achieve

Sustainability Implementation Consultant - Remote

The Sustainability Implementation Consultant will work with our range of award winning UL360 Sustainability Software solutions on customer software implementations, consultancy, training and may deliver related advisory services.

Consultancy and Configuration

Serve as a subject matter expert of product implementation in one or more areas of the product offerings
Assess client's needs and requirements and advise client on best practice or common approach
Identify solution options based on client requirements and author specification documentation
Configure the system as per specification or requirements using the system user interface
Verify (QA) that configuration / implementation is in accordance with the agreed specification
Provide system implementation documentation for handover to our Support teams
Liaison with Product Management for advanced configuration and development of the system
Work with technical teams to resolve system and configuration issues.
Lead customer meetings and calls as and when required in support of larger implementation project, ensuring a professional image at all times
Provide assistance and advice to existing clients including e.g. report generation at critical times of the year
Advise and assist the client in maintaining and enhancing their implemented solution
Serve as configuration workstream lead on complex implementation projects
Provide support, guidance and coaching to more junior team members on projects helping educate them on system functionality

Training

Provide training to clients on implemented functionality
Draft training documentation both generically for the system and for client-specific purposes.

What Makes You a Great Fit

Required skills, knowledge and characteristics

Background in IT. University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
Background or proven keen interest in Sustainability (management & reporting, e.g. GHG, SASB, GRI, CDP) and / or Supply Chain
Effective communicator with good interpersonal skills
Previous 2+ years experience in a customer facing role with a private sector company
High level of numeracy
Strong working knowledge of Excel
Detail oriented
Familiarity with web based applications and software implementation/configuration
Fluent English is essential and additional languages desirable
Ability to learn new software applications rapidly
Knowledge of relational databases or technical expertise is desirable (e.g. SQL, XML)

For more information about the UL360 SaaS software, go to https//www.ul.com/resources/apps/360-sustainability

What You‚Äôll Experience Working At UL

Mission For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn‚Äôt new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 127 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.
People Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you‚Äôll almost always hear, ‚Äúthe people.‚Äù Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We‚Äôre able to deliver the best because we employ the best.
Interesting work Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers‚Äô create. We‚Äôre inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.
Grow & achieve We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles.

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Description:
The Company You‚Äôll Join

At Carta we create owners and make private markets liquid.

We live in a world where some people live on the equity stack and enjoy exponential wealth growth and preferential tax treatment; others live on the debt stack and may work their entire lives for a company and retire only with the cash they‚Äôve managed to save from their paychecks. Our contribution to solving the wealth inequality problem is moving people from the debt stack (payroll) to the equity stack. By making it as easy to issue equity to employees as it is to put them on payroll, we can create more owners.

At Carta, we are helpful, transparent, fair, and kind. We are relentless executors, unconventional thinkers, and masters of our craft.

Learn more about our Series G fundraising round here .

The Team You‚Äôll Work With

You'll be part of the Customer Data Quality team, a team with the mission to ensure the highest data quality standard across customer accounts. Each team member will work on multiple projects with different complexity levels, leveraging your knowledge and existing tools to deliver more value to our customers and internal teams.

The Problems You‚Äôll Solve

As a Data Quality Analyst, you will partner with several teams (R&D, SCSMs, Support, Implementations, Liquidity, 409A, CartaX) to ensure data integrity in customer accounts, while assisting with direction, feedback and acting as a liaison between business and engineering. As part of the role, your day-to-day deliverables will be laying some of the groundwork and documentation for productizing problems.

Conduct thorough account data analysis and deliver them in a timely manner
Assist with data backfill in order to enable customers to take advantage of new features and top priority initiatives
Help customers cleanup off-platform activity (tender offers, recapitalizations, etc.)
Conduct proactive outreach to customers using new strategic features, and relay feedback to PMs
Train customers on the health-check dashboard to empower them to identify and solve their own data quality issues
Ensure all technical teams have the information they need to develop solutions to the problem as efficiently as possible
Collaborate with QA and other teams, coordinating activities and accelerating results
Attend team meetings and development meetings, such as daily stand ups, sprint planning or cage matches.
Identify, record and document bugs thoroughly
Document processes in a detailed, organized and comprehensive way
Contribute to L&D content that will improve the skill level of our Delivery personnel
Become an expert in your product domain, creating leverage for PMs and answering day-to-day questions/issues about the product.
The Impact You‚Äôll Have

Improve Liquidity Readiness in Enterprises and strategic customers, and driving company data accuracy.
Reduce customer effort for our customers, assisting with new features adoption and reducing churn risk
Increase leverage for Product and Engineering by handling/categorizing customer feedback
Empower the Delivery teams and increase product adoption through internal education and training materials.

About You

Experienced current standing in Delivery;
Highly autonomous - able to operate with little to no day-to-day oversight in ambiguity
Organized, detailed, and methodical approach to solving problems
Bias to action - you learn by doing and take small steps even when you face uncertainty.
Helpful - successful cross-functional collaborator, has gone beyond core activities to support other teams, processes and initiatives.
Deep functional and technical knowledge of Carta's platform
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong project management skills - ability to plan and follow up on projects needs and schedules.
Analytical mind and problem-solving aptitude
Ability to think in the abstract and see how small details fit into the bigger picture
Play in the open - critical analysis of existing and new processes/materials: be willing to ask ‚Äòdumb‚Äô questions as you learn.
Strong displayed aptitude in other focus areas of the role/OPITs can be considered as experience regardless of level.

* Please submit all resumes and supplemental documentation in English*

Job Title: Analista de Sistemas Pleno (Banco de Dados) - Remoto
Description:
At UL, we know why we come to work.




Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

What you‚Äôll learn & achieve:

Sustainability Implementation Consultant - Remote

The Sustainability Implementation Consultant will work with our range of award winning UL360 Sustainability Software solutions on customer software implementations, consultancy, training and may deliver related advisory services.

Consultancy and Configuration

Serve as a subject matter expert of product implementation in one or more areas of the product offerings
Assess client's needs and requirements and advise client on best practice or common approach
Identify solution options based on client requirements and author specification documentation
Configure the system as per specification or requirements using the system user interface
Verify (QA) that configuration / implementation is in accordance with the agreed specification
Provide system implementation documentation for handover to our Support teams
Liaison with Product Management for advanced configuration and development of the system
Work with technical teams to resolve system and configuration issues.
Lead customer meetings and calls as and when required in support of larger implementation project, ensuring a professional image at all times
Provide assistance and advice to existing clients including e.g. report generation at critical times of the year
Advise and assist the client in maintaining and enhancing their implemented solution
Serve as configuration workstream lead on complex implementation projects
Provide support, guidance and coaching to more junior team members on projects helping educate them on system functionality

Training

Provide training to clients on implemented functionality
Draft training documentation both generically for the system and for client-specific purposes.

What makes you a great fit:

Required skills, knowledge and characteristics:

Fluent English
Background in IT. University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
Background or proven keen interest in Sustainability (management & reporting, e.g. GHG, SASB, GRI, CDP) and / or Supply Chain
Effective communicator with good interpersonal skills
Previous 2+ years experience in a customer facing role with a private sector company
High level of numeracy
Strong working knowledge of Excel
Detail oriented
Familiarity with web based applications and software implementation/configuration
Ability to learn new software applications rapidly
Knowledge of relational databases or technical expertise is desirable (e.g. SQL, XML)

For more information about the UL360 SaaS software, go to: https://www.ul.com/resources/apps/360-sustainability

What you‚Äôll experience working at UL:

Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn‚Äôt new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 127 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.
People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you‚Äôll almost always hear, ‚Äúthe people.‚Äù Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We‚Äôre able to deliver the best because we employ the best.
Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers‚Äô create. We‚Äôre inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.
Grow & achieve: We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles.

Learn More:

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

Description:
Pipefy is one of OpenView‚Äôs fastest growing tech companies and is recognized in Gartner‚Äôs 2020 Market Guide for Intelligent Business Process Management. Pipefy is a cloud-based, no-code/low-code platform that empowers managers and citizen developers to design, build and automate all processes and workflows. Through a simple Kanban-type interface, companies can achieve process excellence without the need for IT departments, technical skills, or professional services. For customer processes - with complex multi-stakeholder workflows requiring integration to core and vertical/delivery systems, Pipefy has 500+ integrations and an open API to orchestrate and further automate front and back office business processes. Founded in 2015, Pipefy has helped thousands of companies around the world solving business problems on their own. Today, over 3,000 companies in 150+ countries use Pipefy - from startups to industry leaders such as Accenture, Visa, GE, and Volvo.




We‚Äôre looking for people who are passionate about building a robust and scalable data ecosystem to join our data team. Someone dynamic, who takes ownership of their work and the company challenges. Our mission is to enable every single individual inside Pipefy to make data-driven decisions.




Main Responsibilities:

In this position, you will have a deep understanding of the Pipefy platform and its myriad use cases through data as well as interactions with customer-users and internal stakeholders.
You will also have a fast-paced environment, full of enormous challenges, and the possibility to create a global brand.
All the tools you need to do a great job (We‚Äôll spare no expense to make you feel ready to overcome all these challenges).
The chance to work on ambitious projects, alongside technical and entrepreneurial-mindset professionals.
Autonomy to propose and implement new projects.
Collaborate with leadership and customer-facing functions to prioritize, develop, and act on business analyses and experimental hypotheses.
Help the teams to define and measure its KPI‚Äôs.
Support the stakeholders on data-driven decisions.
Perform exploratory analysis.
Create reports, dashboards and provide truthful information to the business areas.
Be able to create an end-to-end analysis, building consolidations, generating insights, and presenting them with focus on business actions.
Be one of the sponsors to create a democratized data-environment by communicating, teaching and creating well documented data models for different audiences.




Requirements:

Ability to analyze, troubleshoot, problem-solve, and present data for cross-functional action.
Ownership over your projects and a sense of urgency regarding high-impact deliveries.
Good storytelling and aptitude for data visualization.
At least 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis function.
Fluency or near fluency in English.
Familiarity with SQL and data-visualization/management tools.
Bachelor 's degree.
Knowledge of Python for data analysis/visualization.
Knowledge of data model and ETL process.




What would be awesome if you had:

A Business, Mathematical, Engineering, or Computer Science concentration or a degree in a related field (though we are more interested in your professional work).
Familiarity with enterprise IT, SaaS, systems integration, and/or cloud technologies a plus (engineering experience is not required).
Client-facing experience and consulting capacities.
Experience in Bigquery/GCP tools.
Already worked in a startup environment during its scaling up process.

About 99:




If you see technology as there to smooth your path in life, our team do too: Your Path, Our Journey.




We believe in people who transform their paths through technology. Technology that connects people who are good at what they do and which practices diversity to create and share those paths that we (as yet!) do not even know about. Our journey is in the smile of every talented person who brings revolution to the world from Brazil - whether with in-app transportation (99), meal delivery (99Food) or digital payments (99Pay).




To make life easier for millions of people every day, we are in the driving seat as part of DiDi Chuxing, the world's largest transport and convenience platform. And so, we can say, with great pride, that we are pioneers in creating solutions, starting in Brazil, that grow in scale and have positive impacts in a range of other countries.




Whether creating projects from scratch or continually improving our solutions, we like challenges that give us butterflies, and that's why we work with intensity, at a fast pace, with respect, collaboration and partnership. On this journey, we also create learning and strengthen ourselves in diversity as a fundamental aspect that makes us stand out our growth day after day.




Diversity & Inclusion




Diversity is not a vision of the future or something we wish to have one day, it is a non-negotiable value of who we are.




We practice inclusion, plurality and respect. And we count on the governance of the Diversity Committee, which works together with HR, leadership and identity groups - 99Adapta, 99Afro, 99Cores, 99Mulheres and 99Mam√£es. This part of our journey has been written, there remains a long road before us.







We reinforce that this position is open to everyone, including pregnant people and people with disabilities (PwD).







About the Job:




As a Senior Data Analytics at 99 you will have the opportunity to impact millions of lives every day.

You‚Äôll drive projects that inspire our data-driven culture, bringing in-depth visibility to our business and identifying key take-aways for decision making and generating actionable insights. You‚Äôll leverage analysis impact by being able to handle both holistic and pin-focused views like a breeze.




Our key goal is to increase company efficiency, have a deeper understanding of our business, and identify opportunities. Our big data stack has tons of data available and high-end tools around the Hadoop ecosystem.




Your responsibilities:




Work closely with business teams to identify opportunities for better decision making.
Analyze large amounts of data to find patterns and generate insights to answer key questions.
Be responsible for data preparation and extraction, development of data pipelines or dashboards needed to perform the analysis.
Create performance indicators and track the impact and efficiency of features and processes.




The successful application:

Has a bachelor's degree (any area).
Has advanced SQL knowledge.
Is able to clearly communicate their findings to a non technical audience.
Has strong organizational and teamwork skills to interact with different stakeholders.
Bonus points for previous experience with Hadoop tools (such as hdfs, spark and hive) and knowledge of a scripting language (such as python or R).

Description:
The Role






We are looking for an experienced Salesforce Data Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you will monitor, validate and enrich global CRM data to drive business planning and actionable insights. We are seeking someone with excellent technical and communication skills, who can work with cross-functional teams to validate data and manage processes driving data quality.















Responsibilities





Data Governance: manage data governance at the direction of the Salesforce product owner. Ensure processes are in place to drive usability, data quality and adherence to compliance policies.
Data Integrity & Strategy: support the Salesforce product owner in drafting ongoing strategies to ensure data integrity as more data is added through multiple processes and integrations (tools and mergers/acquisitions).
Data Quality: manage routine processes to ensure quality is usable, complete and accurate, working to eliminate redundancy and duplication.
User Adoption: work closely with Salesforce users and teams to drive adoption of Salesforce data best practices.
Request Intake & Triage: respond to user requests and triage data quality issues as they arise.
Reporting: create and maintain data quality dashboards, analyzing data to identify areas for improvement across the organization.









Requirements:



Skill Requirements & Experience





Fluent in English
Previous experience with data analysis and data governance management
3-5 years Salesforce.com administrator experience
Salesforce Administrator certification (ADM201) required. Salesforce Sales Cloud certification is a plus.
Thorough understanding of the Salesforce platform and practices.
Experience with complex data migration scenarios and data quality tools
Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment preferred
Passionate about data quality and commitment to continuous improvement
A results-oriented individual who takes initiative, makes things happen and accepts accountability
Ability to establish credibility and rapport with technical and non-technical team members and work collaboratively and cross-functionally
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to quickly understand technical subjects and learn new emerging technologies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required, including experience meeting with and presenting information to senior leadership
Flexibility to meet continuously changing priorities and challenges
Sense of urgency and can learn quickly in a dynamic environment
Bachelor's degree (technical degree preferred)

Description:
GET TO KNOW US

We simplify wellness so you can find everything in one place. Gympass is a corporate wellness platform that connects you to thousands of fitness & wellness partners, all with one simple monthly membership. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 offices around the world. At Gympass, you not only have the opportunity to build a career in a fast-paced global environment - but you'll make wellbeing universal, so everyone can be happy and healthy.

WHAT MAKES A GYMPASSER?

We are passionate about our mission! Whatever your job title is, here you can make a global impact and change people's lives. At Gympass, we collaborate, set high achievable goal expectations, and focus on the end result. It's a challenging, evolving environment that allows you to learn and grow. You will face a disruptive and emerging business model that will push you in several areas, with no boundaries for creation and collaboration.

We are hiring an Engineer to our Data Engineering team in Sao Paulo

YOUR IMPACT

We are looking for a team member to help us grow our Data Engineering team, improve our pipelines, adopt new technologies, and find new ways to democratize data by evolving our platform.

We are responsible to empower all teams by providing a scalable and reliable infrastructure to collect, organize and process the deluge of data generated daily on Gympass with proper Data Governance in place. Our infrastructure is completely in the cloud, running Kubernetes, Presto, Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Flink and more cutting edge projects.

We use software engineering principles to solve large scale production challenges. We build and maintain a data platform, aiming on helping everyone at Gympass to make data-informed decisions.

Who You Are

You have designed and maintained large scale pipelines (really, we have a deluge of data)
You understand how cloud providers works, costs involved and latency
You understand data quality issues and how to troubleshoot them
At your last companies you were responsible for introducing technologies that made people empowered with data.
You are comfortable understanding machine learning and big data concepts to ingest, process and make data available for data scientists and product teams
You are motivated on building tools to democratize data consumption throughout the company
You like studying and learning about new technologies on the data ecosystem, as well as keeping up to date on technologies you already know
You like to teach data-related subjects to people with less experience, fostering their development in the data career
You are really motivated to contribute to a real data-driven culture and see the impact of your work reflected company wide


Competencies Required

Proficient in Python, Java, Go or a similar language (at least one of)
Design and execution of data architectures and pipelines
Basic microservices knowledge
Scheduling tools and workflow management (e.g. Airflow)
Ability to build interfaces for data products (e.g. APIs)
Experienced with data integration
Datalakes architecture, file formats and modeling
Data storages, relational and NoSQL databases
Hadoop and Spark ecosystem
Data streams ingestion and processing
Data infrastructure and Machine Learning Operations
Understands how people interact with data tools to drive the platform evolution


What We Offer You

We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and well-being of our employees. Our benefits include:

WELLNESS: Health, dental, and life insurance health.

GYMPASS DISCOUNT: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to find their passion too.

PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is that our employees take time away from work to recharge.

BR: Vacations after 6 months and 3 days off per year

PAID PARENTAL LEAVE: Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life and we want our employees to take the time to be present and enjoy their growing family.

BR: 100% paid parental leave of 6 weeks to all new parents, of both biological and adopted children, regardless of gender and parent's relationship with the co-parent, Also extended maternity leave under local legislation

CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.

CULTURE: An exciting and supportive atmosphere with ambitious people from around the world!

FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: We give our employees some flexibility to adjust their working hours, letting them adjust their starting time within a range of 3 hours.

And to get a glimpse of Life at Gympass...follow us on Instagram @gympasscareers, Facebook "Life at Gympass" and LinkedIn!

Belonging @ Gympass

Gympass is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Questions on how we treat your personal data? See our Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

Data Analyst at QuintoAndar:

Your job is to help us measure everything along our operating pipeline, analyze data to improve decision making, and be a leader to leverage data analysts. More specifically:

Know by heart our business model and rules.
Be a reference in our relevant data analytics tools/techniques (SQL, prediction, clustering, tracking, looker, python, etc).
Help all company areas to define and track the right metrics to reach their business goals.
Use data insights to recommend and to help make intelligent decisions across teams.
Use prediction and prescriptive methods to support decision-making.
Be an internal influencer towards a data-driven culture and a team player!
Bring new technologies/techniques that enable high business impact opportunities and develop teams to apply them in their projects.




Please only apply if you fulfill these:

You are a pragmatic and data-driven problem solver.
You think outside of the box and are never constrained by the status quo.
You know how to analyze data and you have a least a basic knowledge of statistics, tests, and comparison tools.
You have good knowledge of SQL.
You have experience with visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, etc).




We may like you even better if you:

You know Python and are able to use it as a tool to enhance decision-making.
Have a Business, Statistics, Engineering, or Mathematics background.
Have experience in working at fast-growing startups.

Vem revolucionar o setor financeiro com a gente!

About 99:




If you see technology as there to smooth your path in life, our team do too: Your Path, Our Journey.




We believe in people who transform their paths through technology. Technology that connects people who are good at what they do and which practices diversity to create and share those paths that we (as yet!) do not even know about. Our journey is in the smile of every talented person who brings revolution to the world from Brazil - whether with in-app transportation (99), meal delivery (99Food) or digital payments (99Pay).




To make life easier for millions of people every day, we are in the driving seat as part of DiDi Chuxing, the world's largest transport and convenience platform. And so, we can say, with great pride, that we are pioneers in creating solutions, starting in Brazil, that grow in scale and have positive impacts in a range of other countries.




Whether creating projects from scratch or continually improving our solutions, we like challenges that give us butterflies, and that's why we work with intensity, at a fast pace, with respect, collaboration and partnership. On this journey, we also create learning and strengthen ourselves in diversity as a fundamental aspect that makes us stand out our growth day after day.




Diversity & Inclusion




Diversity is not a vision of the future or something we wish to have one day, it is a non-negotiable value of who we are.




We practice inclusion, plurality and respect. And we count on the governance of the Diversity Committee, which works together with HR, leadership and identity groups - 99Adapta, 99Afro, 99Cores, 99Mulheres and 99Mam√£es. This part of our journey has been written, there remains a long road before us.







We reinforce that this position is open to everyone, including pregnant people and people with disabilities (PwD).







About the Job:




As a Senior Data Analytics at 99 you will have the opportunity to impact millions of lives every day.

You‚Äôll drive projects that inspire our data-driven culture, bringing in-depth visibility to our business and identifying key take-aways for decision making and generating actionable insights. You‚Äôll leverage analysis impact by being able to handle both holistic and pin-focused views like a breeze.




Our key goal is to increase company efficiency, have a deeper understanding of our business, and identify opportunities. Our big data stack has tons of data available and high-end tools around the Hadoop ecosystem.




Your responsibilities:




Work closely with business teams to identify opportunities for better decision making.
Analyze large amounts of data to find patterns and generate insights to answer key questions.
Be responsible for data preparation and extraction, development of data pipelines or dashboards needed to perform the analysis.
Create performance indicators and track the impact and efficiency of features and processes.




The successful application:

Has a bachelor's degree (any area).
Has advanced SQL knowledge.
Is able to clearly communicate their findings to a non technical audience.
Has strong organizational and teamwork skills to interact with different stakeholders.
Bonus points for previous experience with Hadoop tools (such as hdfs, spark and hive) and knowledge of a scripting language (such as python or R).

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) - Relocation to Berlin
Description:
Job location: Berlin, Germany







Profile Summary

We are seeking a driven and ambitious Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team, based in Berlin. Our team provides support across all the teams like Product, Sales and Operations by developing insights and enabling analytical and automated decision making. We build strong partnerships with key stakeholders and work on challenges such as defining, implementing and tracking company-wide metrics, and leading initiatives to improve them

Zenjob is a Berlin-based jobs marketplace with a goal to empower the workforce of tomorrow with innovative technology. We envision a world in which everyone has full control over their working life. We already enable part-time jobbers to decide when, where and how to work with just a few clicks. Our service is available in over 30 cities in Germany and with our recent launch in the Netherlands, we want to gradually open up new international markets.

For us at Zenjob our culture is our key to success. We live every day by our four values: honest, humble, hungry and helpful. We embrace inclusiveness as the core element to shape diverse and therefore powerful teams.




As a (Senior) Data Analyst at Zenjob, you will

Transform all of our business requirements into innovative data solutions, which effectively support our business
Support requests from stakeholders to create new data analyses based on defined specifications
Help the company to create more data-driven solutions and decisions
Support with performance and optimization potential and analyze large datasets to build conclusions
Work with data engineers to convert high-quality and qualified business requirements into technical requirements
Conduct detailed data analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create a new feature




What you‚Äôll bring

3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data as an analyst or equivalent
High proficiency in querying and modelling data using SQL for creating self-service data extracts
Extensive experience using different data visualization and reporting tools. Focus on Tableau is a plus
Ability to translate a business question into an analytical requirement considering its context: what the business is trying to achieve, the processes around it, the systems that interact and the data points available
Analyze the results of A/B-test experiments and derive conclusions or new hypothesis the business can follow up on
Great communication skills in stakeholder management from diverse backgrounds
Great communication skills in storytelling capable of creating a consistent narrative that gives meaning to the numbers

Nice to have

Experience working in marketplaces
Experience using Product analytics tools such as Mixpanel or Amplitude
Experience designing A/B tests




What we offer

Relocation support and visa sponsorship
A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1
28 days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1 day special leave paid for charity work, 5 days of paid educational leave, option of unpaid leave
Hybrid work set-up combining office & remote work, flexible working hours, bring your dog policy
Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations)
30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership
40 EUR credit for Rydes - a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport, bike sharing, etc.
Tax-free meal allowance (saving ~50‚Ç¨ net per month!)
Quarterly team events, winter party, summer party, budget for employee's birthdays & anniversaries




Check out our culture video to see how it's like to work at Zenjob: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3H9EC_ce3jU




If this sounds good, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application
